snippet: Most businesses know the cost of everything that goes into producing what they sell — essential information for setting prices. Medicine is different.
abstract: Cost of medical care at University of Utah Health Care has fallen by 0.5 percent annually, in reverse of current trend, attracting attention of other hospital systems; process by which hospital system determines actual costs in order to pare expenses and improve care has been set in place by Dr Vivian Lee; issue acquires more urgency as Affordable Care Act moves toward one-payment system for hospitals.
lead_paragraph: Most businesses know the cost of everything that goes into producing what they sell — essential information for setting prices. Medicine is different.

headline.main: What Are a Hospital’s Costs? Utah System Is Trying to Learn
headline.print_headline: What Are a Hospital’s Costs? Utah System Is Trying to Learn

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
